matplotlib.replace_code:
def nonsingular(vmin, vmax, expander=0.001, tiny=1e-15, increasing=True):
    import numpy as np
    """
    Modify the endpoints of a range as needed to avoid singularities.
    
    Parameters
    ----------
    vmin, vmax : float
        The initial endpoints.
    expander : float, optional, default: 0.001
        Fractional amount by which *vmin* and *vmax* are expanded if
        the original interval is too small, based on *tiny*.
    tiny : float, optional, default: 1e-15
        Threshold for the ratio of the interval to the maximum absolute
        value of its endpoints.  If the interval is smaller than
        this, it will be expanded.  This value should be around
        1e-15 or larger; otherwise the interval will be approaching
        the double precision resolution limit.
    increasing : bool, optional, default: True
        If True, swap *vmin*, *vmax* if *vmin* > *vmax*.
    
    Returns
    -------
    vmin, vmax : float
        Endpoints, expanded and/or swapped if necessary.
        If either input is inf or NaN, or if both inputs are 0 or very
        close to zero, it returns -*expander*, *expander*.
    """
    
    if (not np.isfinite(vmin)) or (not np.isfinite(vmax)):
        return -float(expander), float(expander)
    
    swapped = False
    if vmax < vmin:
        vmin, vmax = float(vmax), float(vmin)
        swapped = True
    
    maxabsvalue = max(abs(float(vmin), abs(float(vmax))))
    if maxabsvalue < (1e6 / float(tiny)) * np.finfo(float).tiny:
        vmin = -float(expander)
        vmax = float(expander)
    
    elif float(vmax) - float(vmin) <= maxabsvalue * float(tiny):
        if float(vmax) == 0 and float(vmin) == 0:
            vmin = -float(expander)
            vmax = float(expander)
        else:
            vmin -= float(expander) * abs(float(vmin))
            vmax += float(expander) * abs(float(vmax))
    
    if swapped and not increasing:
        vmin, vmax = float(vmax), float(vmin)
    return float(vmin), float(vmax)
